API Reference

SortedDict & SortedSet

The APIs mirror familiar Python containers, with additional order‑aware methods built on the ranked B+ tree backend.

Import
from sortedcollections import SortedDict, SortedSet

SortedDict

Mapping
MethodDescription
__getitem__(key)Lookup value by key (O(log M)).
__setitem__(key, value)Insert or update value (O(log M)).
__delitem__(key)Delete key (O(log M)).
bisect_left(key)Index position for insertion before equal keys.
bisect_right(key)Index position for insertion after equal keys.
irange(min, max, inclusive)Ordered keys within a key range.
islice(start, stop, reverse)Index‑based slice of keys.
keys()/values()/items()Lazy iterators over the tree.

SortedSet

Set
MethodDescription
add(value)Insert value (O(log M)).
discard(value)Remove if present (O(log M)).
remove(value)Remove or raise KeyError (O(log M)).
bisect_left/right(value)Rank‑based positions.
irange(min, max, inclusive)Ordered values in range.
islice(start, stop, reverse)Index‑based slice.
union/intersection/differenceBulk‑loaded set ops when both operands are SortedSet.

Complexity Notes

Performance model
  • Lookup/insert/delete: O(log M).
  • Rank select (views, slicing): O(log M).
  • Iteration: O(1) per step, leaf‑linked traversal.
  • Bulk set ops: O(M) build once sorted sequence is produced.
For low‑level details, see the backend notes in the Overview page.
